definitions.definition: To pronounce a sound with the tongue against the palate of the mouth when that sound normally would not be so pronounced.
examples: Most English speakers palatalize the letter t in the word "nature".

definitions.definition: To be pronounced with the tongue against the palate.
definitions.label_groups: phonetics , intransitive , unaccusative , of a sound

main_definition: ( phonetics , transitive ) To pronounce a sound with the tongue against the palate of the mouth when that sound normally would not be so pronounced.
secondary_definitions: ( phonetics , intransitive , unaccusative , of a sound ) To be pronounced with the tongue against the palate.
